patterns_discovered: Proper separation of concerns between game logic (Board class) and UI representation (GameGrid class)
Use of callback pattern for handling cell click events instead of direct tight coupling
Windows Minesweeper color reproduction through NUMBER_COLORS mapping
Proper Tkinter grid layout management with cell_size parameterization
Event binding using lambda closures to capture row/column coordinates
Comprehensive cell state handling (unrevealed, revealed, flagged, mine states)
Modular design supporting resize functionality for different difficulty levels
gotchas_discovered: Callback functions in lambda closures need explicit default parameter binding (r=row, c=col) to avoid late binding issues
Board object validation is explicitly handled to prevent None reference errors
Coordinate validation in update_cell method with proper error messages including board dimensions
Cell size validation prevents invalid or zero/negative dimensions
Proper widget cleanup in resize method to prevent memory leaks
discoveries.approach_outcome: The implementation successfully created a complete game grid UI with clickable cells. The approach used a dedicated GameGrid class to separate UI concerns from game logic, implemented proper event handling with callbacks, and included comprehensive cell state management. The result matches Windows Minesweeper visual appearance with proper colors, button states (raised/sunken), and emoji symbols (flag and mine). The integration with MainWindow creates the foundation for full game interaction.
